answers.content_html: Most swimming animals use fins; therefore, fins are an adaptation to swimming.
answers.feedback_html: No result can be predicted from this statement. Therefore, the reasoning is not deductive.

answers.content_html: Mitochondria are inherited from the mother; therefore, maternally inherited traits are encoded by mitochondrial DNA
answers.feedback_html: This is not an example of deductive approach.

answers.content_html: Small animals lose more heat than larger animals. One would not expect to find wild mice in the poles.
answers.feedback_html: This statement does not represent the deductive approach.

answers.content_html: Water conservation is a major requirement to survive in the desert. Long leaves increase loss of water by evaporation. Therefore, desert plants should have smaller leaves.
answers.feedback_html: The example given represents deductive reasoning because from a general premise, results are predicted.

stem_html: Which of the following is an example of deductive reasoning?

answers.content_html: hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: The correct ranking with respect to increasing complexity is hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system.

answers.content_html: hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, artery, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Veins are a part of the cardiovascular system. Veins and arteries are both types of blood vessels.

answers.content_html: red blood cells, hemoglobin, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Red blood cells have higher complexity than hemoglobin.

answers.content_html: oxygen, carbon dioxide, red blood cells, hemoglobin, blood, artery, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Oxygen and carbon dioxide are not part of the cardiovascular system.

stem_html: Consider the cardiovascular system. Rank in order of increasing complexity all its levels of organization starting with the hemoglobin.

answers.feedback_html: Surface area must be calculated using the square of the radius.
The calculation of surface area is not correct.
The lighting fixture has to be lowered to the calculated height to provide the required illuminance.

stem_html: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) recommends an illuminance of 500\,\text{lx} for desktop lighting. An office space has lighting hung 2.50\,\text{m} above desktop level that provides only 300\,\text{lx}. To what height would the lighting fixtures have to be lowered to provide 500\,\text{lx} on desktops?
